column5: Thanks. I’m impressed with the build quality of it.

The one down side is that you can’t trim out a Jet Drive so they can be a little rougher in the waves. Also coming into dock is a bit more of an adventure. You only have steering control when you have thrust, also they do not reverse fast. So it is a little more unforgiving.
It does ?
Nice. You see those on the Fraser R. sturgeon fishing shows.
Now there is one head turner. That hull looks very StarCraft. Congrats Sir, she is gonna move tout suite.
Looking forward to getting this out on the water.
For an old man you're sure gonna scoot in that beautiful jet rig! Congrats!!
nice ride
That will be fun to fish out of.
Nice looking boat
WOW Very nice rig
Nice rig!
SICK WITH ENVY
Wait, fill us in on this awesome rig!  is that a jet drive? what are the dual canisters that look like mufflers under the platform? Pics pics and more pics!
Very nice!
Double post
Yes it’s a jet boat and those are the exhaust.
Had it out for the break in. It does get up and move.
Very nice boat indeed, congratulations. Looks like it'll handle big water without any issues.
Very nice! Something you don't see around here everyday!
Nice!!!
https://kingfisherboats.com/boats/river-jet-1875-falcon/ Nice looking boat!
very sexy boat!
Is it brand new? Man, I am so jealous.
Yes it is. Takes a little bit to get use to the Jet Drive. Handles completely different.
Up north with all the rocks no lower unit in the water is a plus? How big is your kicker motor? the prop looks huge?
It looks like It’s doing 100mph but it’s still on the trailer.
200 hp on a 19 foot aluminum should move well!
That is one SWEET rig!
We have a lot of rocks and reefs in our lake and many channels, creeks and rivers. It’s a 9.9 Merc Pro Kicker four stroke. It moves it along nicely.
